poem:
Title: "In Earshot of Others' Narratives."

Radio waves sing in the cool morning,
each program a tune, distinct yet merging.
From Gangster's steel echo,
to Vorderman's unwavering refrain,
Mangan's melodic rises and wanes.

Finnish whispers of humane abodes,
Unhoused hearts find their road.
All tales tangled in my tea steam,
Meet me in the space of a dream. 

Breath caught, ear to the soft hum,
life narrated under the rising sun.
